\chapter{wrapper}
\label{\detokenize{source/wrapper:wrapper}}\label{\detokenize{source/wrapper::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Tag}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Graph}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Maps}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Complete object\sphinxhyphen{}oriented wrappers over the API. Allows quering the server and accessing
the return information directly via the Python objects.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
For all of the classes below if the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aio}} flag is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}} then the object will
automatically query the API without needing further action. However, if the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aio}}
flag is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} one must \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{await}} the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{call()}} function associated
with the object to make the query to the server.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Maps}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{asyncio}

\PYG{k}{async} \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Maps}\PYG{p}{(}
        \PYG{n}{x1}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{80.48712034709753}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{y1}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{25.750749758162012}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{x2}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{79.82794065959753}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{y2}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{25.854604964203453}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{zoom}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{12}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{aio}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}
    \PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{await} \PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{call}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\bigskip\hrule\bigskip

\chapter{api}
\label{\detokenize{source/api:api}}\label{\detokenize{source/api::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{api}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Direct API call to DisplayPurposes with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json}} returns. Support for synchronous and asynchronous
function call.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This module can either be used synchronous or asynchronous via the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aio}} flag passed to each
of the functions below. By default \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aio}} is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}}, but when setting it to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}
the return will be an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Awaitable}} that can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{await}} to query the API.
\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
One may use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aio}} flag to dictate whether to use the function asynchronously
or synchronously.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{api}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{io}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Uses \PYGZsq{}requests\PYGZsq{} to send requests.\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{api}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{graph} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{api}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{maps} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{api}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{maps}\PYG{p}{(}
        \PYG{n}{x1}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{80.48712034709753}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{y1}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{25.750749758162012}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{x2}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{79.82794065959753}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{y2}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{25.854604964203453}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{zoom}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{12}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{async} \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{aio}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Uses \PYGZsq{}aiohttp\PYGZsq{} to send requests.\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k}{await} \PYG{n}{api}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aio}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{graph} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k}{await} \PYG{n}{api}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aio}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}

\chapter{http}
\label{\detokenize{source/http:http}}\label{\detokenize{source/http::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{http} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Base}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Requests}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Aiohttp}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Low\sphinxhyphen{}level HTTP calls to DisplayPurposes with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json}} returns. Allows customization with
“plug\sphinxhyphen{}and\sphinxhyphen{}play” support for any other Python HTTP request library. Comes out of the box
with support for both the  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{requests}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{aiohttp}} packages.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The classes documented here are not intended to be used for querying the API\sphinxhyphen{} they are here
to allow customization support for anyone looking to use their own HTTP request library to
send requests to the API.

If you are looking for retrieving back the raw \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json}} objects without carying much about
implementation, check out the documentations for the {\hyperref[\detokenize{source/api:api}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{api}}}} module.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\bigskip\hrule\bigskip

\index{endpoints (class in instahashtag.http)@\spxentry{endpoints}\spxextra{class in instahashtag.http}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.endpoints}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{endpoints}}}
API endpoints.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

    \PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{https://apidisplaypurposes.com/tag/}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{n}{graph} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{https://apidisplaypurposes.com/graph/}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{n}{maps} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{https://apidisplaypurposes.com/local/?bbox=}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZam{}zoom=}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{Base (class in instahashtag.http)@\spxentry{Base}\spxextra{class in instahashtag.http}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Base}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{endpoint}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{headers}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{dict}}}{}
Base class that properly processes and calls the API.

Allows one to “plug\sphinxhyphen{}and\sphinxhyphen{}play” with other request libraries with ease. If one wants to,
they may inherit from this class and overwrite the abstract {\hyperref[\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.call}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{call()}}}}} method.
\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
While the module \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpx}} is not supported out of the box, one may inherit from the
{\hyperref[\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Base}}}}} class and utilize it.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{instahashtag}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{http} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Base}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{httpx}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{httpx\PYGZus{}io}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Base}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{call}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{req} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{httpx}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{endpoint}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{resp} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{req}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{text}

        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Note that self.process is just a simple wrapper for \PYGZsq{}json.loads\PYGZsq{}.}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} One has the option to also overwrite this to catch any extra error(s),}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} or run processes on the data.}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{process}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{resp}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{httpx\PYGZus{}aio}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Base}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{async} \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{call}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{async} \PYG{k}{with} \PYG{n}{httpx}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{AsyncClient}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{client}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{req} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k}{await} \PYG{n}{client}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{endpoint}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n}{resp} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{req}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{text}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{process}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{resp}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{io}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{httpx\PYGZus{}io}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{graph} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{httpx\PYGZus{}io}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hashtag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{instagram}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{maps} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{httpx\PYGZus{}io}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{maps}\PYG{p}{(}
        \PYG{n}{x1}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{80.48712034709753}\PYG{p}{,}

\index{call() (Base method)@\spxentry{call()}\spxextra{Base method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.call}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{abstract }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{call}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ NotImplemented}}
Abstract method that needs to be written to query the API endpoint.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{process() (Base static method)@\spxentry{process()}\spxextra{Base static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.process}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{process}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{resp}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ dict}}
Processes the reply returned back by {\hyperref[\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.tag}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tag}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.graph}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{graph}}}}}, and {\hyperref[\detokenize{source/http:instahashtag.http.Base.maps}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maps}}}}}.

The current implementation of this function is a simple \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json.loads(resp)}}, returning
back a Python dictionary object. However, one may chose to overwrite this function to
process the data in some more meaningful way.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{tag() (Base class method)@\spxentry{tag()}\spxextra{Base class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
